comments.body: I suppose I have some reservations about this, but what would fix this is to change the topmost message to "The type argument for type parameter 'T' cannot be inferred from the usage **_of 'foo'**_."

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@    var z5 = foo({ name: "abc", a: 5 });  // { name: string; a: number }
    var z6 = foo({ name: "abc", a: 5 }, { name: "def", b: 5 });  // error
                                                       ~~~~
!!! error TS2453: The type argument for type parameter 'T' cannot be inferred from the usage. Consider specifying the type arguments explicitly.
!!! error TS2453:   Type argument candidate '{ name: string; a: number; }' is not a valid type argument because it is not a supertype of candidate '{ name: string; b: number; }'.

comments.body: breaking change, another interesting case, each element does extend Item but has a disjoint set of additional members
Yup, that is the flip side of not inferring a union type.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +16,20 @@    var z6 = foo({ name: "abc", a: 5 }, { name: "def", b: 5 });  // error
             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2346: Supplied parameters do not match any signature of call target.
